translations: n.（修辞学上的）惯用语句；（文学创作的）传统的主题

phrs.translation: 地方, 处所, 拓扑异构酶, 论式

sentences.sentence: James Joyce USES the topos of the wandering Jew in his Ulysses.
sentences.translation: 詹姆斯·乔伊斯在他的《尤利西斯》中采用了流浪的犹太人这一传统主题。

sentences.sentence: If they are found on the same place, it is iso-topos. These are called isotopes.
sentences.translation: 如果是在同一个位置，按照国际惯例，它们被叫做同位素。

sentences.sentence: He, , for his part, also had a certain sense of the topos, when what was in question was the orderof nature.
sentences.translation: 就他而言，他也有某些这种「地形学」的感觉，当自然的秩序在这里被置疑到。 %。
